titles.title: Gädlä Täklä Haymanot “Vita of Täklä Haymanot” / Mäṣḥafä lǝdätu lä-ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot “Book of the Genealogy of ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot” / Mälkǝʿa Täklä Haymanot “Image of Täklä Haymanot” / Täʾamrä Täklä Haymanot “Miracles of ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Gädlä Täklä Haymanot “Vita of Täklä Haymanot” (fols. 4ra-88vb; 90ra-96vb) II) Mäṣḥafä lǝdätu lä-ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot “Book of the Genealogy of ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot” (fol. 97ra-vb) - Genealogy of Täklä Haymanot (fols. 97ra-vb) - Wä-näbärä ʾabba Yoḥanni bä-Däbrä Dammo... “And ʾabba Yoḥanni lived in Däbrä Dammo...” (fols. 97vb-98vb) III) Mälkǝʾa Täklä Haymanot “Image of Täklä Haymanot”(fols. 100ra-102ra) IV) Täʾamrä Täklä Haymanot “Miracles of Täklä Haymanot”: 16 miracles (fols. 104vb-113ra)
Additiones 1-4; colophon.

copyists.copyist: According to the colophon, the Ms was written by Wäldä Śǝllase of Däbrä Dammo.

donors.donor: Wäldä Dǝngǝl (mentioned in the supplication formulas, fols. 4ra, 13va, 60vb, 88vb; depicted as donor on fol. 89v). His wife Wälättä Ḥǝywät, their sons Zä-Śǝllase and Kidanä Maryam are also mentioned on fol. 4ra. Gäbäz Dǝmḍä Mikaʾel is referred to as the second donor in the colophon (his name is added interlineally, in a secondary hand, in reddish brown ink, on fol. 48rb). Gäbrä Täklä Haymanot appears to have been the donor for the part containing the Miracles (quire XIII; s. fols. 106ra, 107ra).

dcomments.dcomment: The colophon states that the Ms. was written “at the time of our bishop ʾabba Sälama, at the time of his retirement to Däbrä Dammo”. Sälama III, Metropolitan of Ethiopia in 1841-67, stayed the monastery of Däbrä Dammo from the end of 1847 till the end of 1848, where he withdrew after a conflict with King Tewodros II. Cp. M. ABIR, Ethiopia: The Era of the Princes. The Challenge of Islam and the Re-unification of the Christian Empire 1769-1855, London, 1970, 134-35. Quire XIII (Text IV) dates to a later time time.

txstates.txstate: The spine cover is damaged at the top and at the bottom. Quire XIII is attached to the book block with cords.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Overback made of leather of different colour. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: triple line fillet, single circle, corni-form, criss cross, double arabesque, x-form).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. Turn-ins are laced with cords.

squires.squire:
A(3; s.l.: 1, stub after 3/fols. 1r-3v) – I፩(8; s.l.: 3, 6, stubs after 2, 5/fols. 4r-11v) – II፪(8/fols. 12r-19v) – III፫(8/fols. 20r-27v) – ፫IV፬(8/fols. 28r-35v) – ፬V፭(10; s.l.: 3, 8, stubs after 3, 8/fols. 36r-45v) – ፭VI፮(10/fols. 46r-55v) – ፮VII፯(8; s.l.: 3, 8, stubs after 3, 8/fols. 56r-63v) – ፯VIII፰(8/fols. 64r-71v) – ፰IX፱(8; s.l.: 3, 6, stubs after 2, 5/fols. 72r-79v) – ፱X፲(10; s.l.: 4, 7, stubs after 3, 6/fols. 80r-89v) – ፲XI(10; s.l.: 4, 7, stubs after 3, 6/fols. 90r-99v) – XII(4/fols. 100r-103v) – <XIII(10; s. l.: 4, 7, stubs after 4, 7/fols. 104r-113v)>
Quire XIII was added later, its leaves are of smaller size.

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible. Ruling pricks are mostly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written one line above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: All data for fol. 104r (quire XIII). Folio dimension: 20.5x27.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible. Ruling pricks are mostly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Hand a: 19th century. Hand b: recent

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a (quires I-XII) Hand b (quire XIII)

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; names of the protagonist and other saints; names of the metropolitan, the donors and the scribe; incipit of Text I and its subsections (fols. 4ra, 10va, 13va, 24vb, 41ra, 48rb, 60vb, 61va, 71vb, 79rb-79va, 90ra, 95ra, 96va); incipit of Text II and its subsection (fol. 97vb); incipit of Text III; incipits of Text IV; incipit of Additio 1; incipit of Additio 2; notes written in the upper margin; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals; elements of the quire marks.
On the incipit pages of Text I, of some of its subsections, and of Text III (fols. 4r, 41ra, 60vb, 71vb, 79rb-79va, 90ra, 100r), a few lines are rubricated (alternating with black lines).

otherdetails.otherdetail: The text of the Vita represents the first of the two sub-types of the Däbrä Libanos recension of the Gädlä Täklä Haymanot (close, but not identical to the published text of the Vita, s. E.A.W. BUDGE (ed., tr.), The Life and Miracles of Takla Hâymânôt in the Version of Dabra Lîbânôs..., London 1906). The text from fol. 104vb continues on fol. 113ra.

colophon.tran: Fol. 98va-vb: This book was written at the time of ... and at the time of our bishop ˀabba Sälama, at the time of his retirement to Däbrä Dammo. I let it be written, I, sinner and wrongdoer, Wäldä Dəngəl, when I was overcome by love for the Vita of our father Täklä Haymanot, knowing that before (my time) there had been no Vita of our father Täklä Haymanot at (the church of) Däbrä Mikaˀel Qärsäbär, so that it may serve for the benefit of my soul. The aid of this righteous (man) is the adornment of the glory of the sanctuary. May the power of his prayer cover us in the day of sadness and need. The scribe (of this book) Wäldä Śəllase of Däbrä Dammo, its commissioner Wäldä Dəngəl, its reader and its interpreter, and the one who hears it with the ear of the Spirit – may He have mercy upon all of them in the Kingdom of Heaven; and also its gäbäz Dəmḍä Mikaˀel. I also let it be written in order that it may be for me a medicine for the body and soul. He who steals it or erases (its text) is excommunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul and by the word of our father bishop Sälama. And do not forget Wäldä Dəngəl; each of you (recite for him) the Paternoster. Amen and amen. So be it, so be it.

additional.cont: Fol. 89ra-rb: Short version of the genealogy of Täklä Haymanot.
Fol. 89rb-vb: Note on the 17th-cent. history of Däbrä Dammo and Däbrä Libanos.
additional.det: The note recounts about the arrival of ʾabba Zä-Wängel, mämhǝr of Däbrä Libanos of Šäwa, at Däbrä Dammo in the eighth year of the reign of Susǝnyos (Śǝlṭan Sägäd, r. 1607-32), i.e. 1614. It is stated that ʾabba Zä-Wängel arrived in Däbrä Dammo “desiring to renew that what had become old and follow in the footsteps of his father Täklä Haymanot”.

additional.cont: Fol. 99v: Note on a litigation.
additional.det: In Amharic. Dated 12 Miyazya, 1932 A.M. (= 20 April, 1940 A.D.). Continued in the bottom margin of fol. 100r.

additional.cont: Fol. 102v: Record concerning a litigation.
additional.det: In Amharic; dated 5 Gǝnbot, 1937 A.M. (= 13 May, 1945 A.D.).

extras.extra: - Half-erased (ownership?) note,<...> ማኅበረ᎓ ቀርሰ᎓ በር᎓ ብሩካን: fol. 63v, in the bottom margin. - Pen trial: fol. 1r. - Writing exercise: fol. 103r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire marks are usually written in the upper and lower left corner of the first fol. of the quire and in the upper and lower right corner of the last fol. of the quire: fols. 4r, 19v, 27v, 28r, 35v, 36r, 45v, 46r, 55v, 56r, 63v, 64r, 71v, 72r, 79v, 80r, 89v, 90r, 99v. - Quire XI is numbered ፩ on fols. 98v, 99r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Monthly readings of Text I are indicated by the names of the months written in the upper margin, in crude secondary hands, in pen: ታህሳስ: fol. 4r ዘመስከረም: fol. 10v (crossed out) ዘመጋቢት: fol. 13v ዘታህሳስ: fol. 14v (crossed our) ዘጥቅምት: fol. 24v ዘህዳር: fol. 41r ዘታህሳስ: fol. 48r (in the main hand, in ink) ዘጥር: fol. 60v ዘየካቲት: fol. 71r ዘሚያዝያ: fol. 79v ዘግንቦት: fol. 87v ዘሐምሌ: fol. 87v (in the main hand, in red) ዘነሐሴ: fol. 90r. - Monthly readings of Text IV are indicated by the names of the months written in the upper margin, in hand b: ዘነሐሴ: fol. 108v ዘታህሳስ: fol. 110r.

miniature.info: Fol. 89v: St. Täklä Haymanot with Wäldä Dǝngǝl, donor.
miniature.details: Wäldä Dǝngǝl is the commissioner of the Ms.

frames.frame: - Fol. 4r: wide coloured (red, green, yellow, white) ornamental frame with one central and two lateral pendants reaching page bottom; geometric and floral motifs. - Fol. 5vb: Coloured (red, yellow, white) ornamental band; geometric motif. - Fol. 10va: Coloured (red, green, yellow) ornamental band with simple ornamentation motif. - Fol. 24vb: Coloured (red, green, yellow) ornamental band; geometric motif. - Fol. 41ra: Coloured (red, green, white) ornamental band; geometric motif. - Fol. 60vb: Coloured (red, green, yellow) ornamental band; geometric motif. - Fol. 61va: Coloured (red, green, white) ornamental band with simple ornamentation motif. - Fol. 71vb: Coloured (red, green, yellow, white) ornamental band; geometric motif. - Fol. 79rb: Coloured ornamental band; geometric motif. - Fol. 90ra: Coloured (red, green, yellow, white, black) ornamental band; geometric motif.
